meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Stuart Anderson Emily Horne Chris Gaiman Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6687.

td.p: Stuart Anderson, a JAG originally from New Orleans, Louisiana
Emily Horne, a State Department press advisor from Washington, D.C.
Chris Gaiman, a post-production coordinator originally from Slatington, Pennsylvania (whose 1-day cash winnings total $14,401)

tr.td: TRAVEL BOOKS
CELEBRITIES' KIDS' NAMES
THE CHURCH OF JESUS CHRIST OF LATTER-DAY SAINTS
HIT PARADES
HATS ALL, FOLKS
"PUN" INTENDED

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'Paul Theroux\' "Riding the Iron Rooster" takes readers through China by this method')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: Paul Theroux' "Riding the Iron Rooster" takes readers through China by this method

')

the Rose Parade

tr.td: Chris
Emily
Stuart
SIR WALTER RALEIGH
SUPERFOODS
LIBRARIES
SINGERS ON THE SOUNDTRACK
OCEANIA
(Each correct response...)
STARTS WITH A QUESTION WORD

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_DJ_5_5', 'clue_DJ_5_5_stuck', '(Jimmy of the Clue Crew shows us a map of part of South America and the Pacific Ocean.) In 1766 Philip Carteret and Samuel Wallis sailed from England in two ships. Storms separated them and while Carteret discovered Pitcairn, Wallis found this other island that\'s part of the H.M.S. Bounty story')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew shows us a map of part of South America and the Pacific Ocean.) In 1766 Philip Carteret and Samuel Wallis sailed from England in two ships. Storms separated them and while Carteret discovered Pitcairn, Wallis found this other island that's part of the H.M.S. Bounty story

Chapter 1 of this 1952 book ends, "This is about the way the Salinas valley was when my grandfather... settled in the foothills"

New champion: $16,801

Emily
Stuart

6 W
(including 1 DD)

(including 2 DDs),
